items.title: A New Way to Bank
items.text: Last year, David **decided** to switch to a neobank. He **downloaded** the app in January. The onboarding process **started** with his email verification. He **scanned** his ID and **uploaded** a photo of a utility bill as proof of address. The bank **verified** his identity using AI. Within minutes, David **received** a notification: 'Account Approved'. He **transferred** his savings and **started** using the virtual card immediately.

questions.question: When did David download the app?
questions.explanation: The text states David downloaded the app in January.

questions.question: What did he use as proof of address?
questions.explanation: He uploaded a photo of a utility bill.

questions.question: How did the bank verify his identity?
questions.explanation: The text mentions the bank verified his identity using AI.

items.title: Onboarding Issues
items.transcript:
Customer: Hello, I'm trying to open an account, but I'm stuck.
Agent: I see. Did you finish the KYC steps?
Customer: Yes, I scanned my passport and took the selfie. But I didn't receive the confirmation email.
Agent: Did you check your spam folder?
Customer: Oh, let me see... Yes, it arrived there ten minutes ago. I missed it!
Agent: No problem. Please click the link in that email to activate your account.

questions.question: What steps did the customer already complete?
questions.explanation: The customer says 'I scanned my passport and took the selfie'.

questions.question: Where was the confirmation email?
questions.explanation: The customer found it in the spam folder.

questions.question: What must the customer do next?
options: Click a link in the email
questions.explanation: The agent tells him to click the link in the email.

items.title: Security Alerts
items.text: Yesterday, Maria **received** a push notification on her phone. It **asked**: 'Did you spend $500 in London?' Maria **worried** because she was at home in Madrid. She **logged in** to her app and **checked** her recent activity. She **realized** someone **stole** her card details. She **pressed** the 'Freeze Card' button immediately. Then, she **called** the bank support. They **blocked** the card permanently and **ordered** a new one.

questions.question: Where was Maria when she got the notification?
questions.explanation: The text says she was at home in Madrid.

questions.question: What was the first thing Maria did in the app?
options: She logged in and checked activity
questions.explanation: She logged in and checked her recent activity first.

questions.question: How did she stop the card from being used?

items.title: Travel Notification
items.transcript:
Agent: Good morning, you've reached Global Bank support.
Customer: Hello, I'm traveling to Japan tomorrow. Do I need to tell you?
Agent: Yes, it's better. We marked your account for international travel.
Customer: Great. I also activated my virtual card. Will it work there?
Agent: Yes, you can use it for contactless payments everywhere in Japan.
Customer: Excellent. I checked my limits too, they are fine. Thanks!

questions.question: Where is the customer going?
questions.explanation: The customer says they are traveling to Japan.

questions.question: What did the customer already activate?
questions.explanation: The customer says 'I also activated my virtual card'.

questions.question: What else did the customer check?
questions.explanation: The customer says 'I checked my limits too'.
